lexUnit.name: jump.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: push oneself off the ground using the muscles in one's legs and feet

sentence.text: Then suddenly I get all cold , and I have to jump around a bit to get warm .
Lefevre opened the door and jumped out .
She was skirting the moving foam , a foot away , and jumped sideways when a wave overreached .
In his excitement Benny jumped backwards and tripped over a lump of wood .
With a choked little cry he jumped backwards , turned and plunged into the unseen , gripping the banister and screwing his eyes tightly closed as he ran .
The tutor appeared unsure , but the boy jumped up from his place , rushing to Beth and grabbing her by the hand .
I jumped up suddenly and ran into the crowds of people in the dark .
I remember that on the day on which the news of the Hiroshima bomb was published he was jumping up and down saying ` How could anyone work on a day like this ? "
Stepson , a short-haired cat of some unaccountable breed , jumps up beside me on the seat .
` It 's like jumping off the roof of a three-storey house , " he said , ` and then having the house chase you down the street . "

" She jumped off the bed heavily .
They all had to jump overboard and a lot of them drowned . "
The coachman jumped down , raised his hat and held open the nearside door .
The whole train stopped while he jumped down from the dome car and went to look at the laggard .
Flora put her hands over her ears and began to jump about all over the kitchen .
I jumped over the wall and ran along the bank and jumped straight into the stream , " he said yesterday .
One morning in mid-January I jumped over the railings and climbed up to the parapet of the gate .
I waited while he jumped down into the clearing and disappeared .
So he jumped head first into the forty-gallon oil-drum full of rainwater which stood at the rear of the caravan .
Elaine chuckled as she reached the bottom of the cliff and jumped from a smooth , rounded boulder into the shallow water .
The lion immediately jumps on him and forces him to the ground .
Yet jumping on the bed she could almost be a normal , happy little girl .
He jumped in a car from the Paris collections and drove to the set in the country where she was filming .
Not wanting to jump in at the deep end , I hired the school the day before and went with Karen , a friend who wanted to give her experienced but spooky horse an indoor schooling session .
A suspected burglar is on the run after he escaped from police by jumping through a court room window .
As fast as I could , I ran down the hill and jumped out of the trees between the prisoner and the two wild men .
She jumped across the ditch that marked the entrance to the woods .
His 22-year-old step grandchild Madjit was forced to jump from the first floor with his pyjamas ablaze .
She laughed and jumped about with the Palernians , trying to burst the bubbles .
He jumped in the van and left her there .
The policeman was knocked off his feet as Michael jumped from the car .
